001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder;
002
003import static io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.JsonBuffer.EXTENDED_F;
004
005import java.io.PrintWriter;
006import java.io.StringWriter;
007import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
008import java.time.Instant;
009import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
010import java.util.Map;
011import java.util.Objects;
012import java.util.function.Consumer;
013
014import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
015
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.KeyValues;
017import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
018import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder;
019import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent;
020import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogFormatter.LevelFormatter;
021import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
022import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
023import io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.JsonBuffer;
024import io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.JsonBuffer.ExtendedFieldPrefix;
025import io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.JsonBuffer.JSONToken;
026
027/**
028 * A JSON encoder in
029 * <a href="https://go2docs.graylog.org/5-2/getting_in_log_data/gelf.html">GELF JSON
030 * format</a>.
031 */
032public final class GelfEncoder extends LogEncoder.AbstractEncoder<JsonBuffer> {
033
034        /**
035         * GELF encoder URI scheme.
036         */
037        public static final String GELF_SCHEME = "gelf";
038
039        private final String host;
040
041        private final KeyValues headers;
042
043        private final boolean prettyprint;
044
045        private static final DateTimeFormatter timeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ISO_INSTANT;
046
047        GelfEncoder(String host, KeyValues headers, boolean prettyprint) {
048                super();
049                this.host = host;
050                this.headers = headers;
051                this.prettyprint = prettyprint;
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * Creates a GELF encoder using a lambda for easier registration. The builder will
056         * have properties loaded after the consumer has configured the builder.
057         * @param consumer lambda to configure builder.
058         * @return GELF encoder provider.
059         */
060        public static LogConfig.Provider<GelfEncoder> of(Consumer<GelfEncoderBuilder> consumer) {
061                return (s, c) -> {
062                        var b = new GelfEncoderBuilder(s);
063                        consumer.accept(b);
064                        return b.fromProperties(c.properties()).build();
065                };
066        }
067
068        /**
069         * Creates GELF Encoder.
070         * @param name property name prefix.
071         * @param host host field in GELF.
072         * @param headers additional headers that will be prefix with "_".
073         * @param prettyPrint <code>true</code> will pretty print the JSON, default is false.
074         * @return encoder.
075         */
076        @LogConfigurable(prefix = LogProperties.ENCODER_PREFIX)
077        static GelfEncoder of(@LogConfigurable.KeyParameter String name, String host, //
078                        @LogConfigurable.ConvertParameter("convertHeaders") @Nullable Map<String, String> headers,
079                        @Nullable Boolean prettyPrint) {
080                prettyPrint = prettyPrint == null ? false : prettyPrint;
081                host = Objects.requireNonNull(host);
082                var _headers = KeyValues.of(headers == null ? Map.of() : headers);
083
084                return new GelfEncoder(host, _headers, prettyPrint);
085        }
086
087        static Map<String, String> convertHeaders(String headers) {
088                return LogProperties.parseMap(headers);
089        }
090
091        @Override
092        protected JsonBuffer doBuffer() {
093                return new JsonBuffer(this.prettyprint, ExtendedFieldPrefix.UNDERSCORE);
094        }
095
096        @Override
097        protected void doEncode(LogEvent event, JsonBuffer buffer) {
098                buffer.clear();
099                var formattedMessage = buffer.getFormattedMessageBuilder();
100                final String host = this.host;
101                event.formattedMessage(formattedMessage);
102                final String shortMessage = formattedMessage.toString();
103                Instant now = event.timestamp();
104                final double timeStamp = ((double) now.toEpochMilli()) / 1000;
105                @Nullable
106                String fullMessage = null;
107                var t = event.throwableOrNull();
108                if (t != null) {
109                        StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
110                        sw.write(shortMessage);
111                        sw.write("\n");
112                        t.printStackTrace(new PrintWriter(sw));
113                        fullMessage = sw.toString();
114                }
115                int level = levelToSyslogLevel(event.level());
116                buffer.write(JSONToken.OBJECT_START);
117                int index = 0;
118                index = buffer.write("host", host, index);
119                index = buffer.write("short_message", shortMessage, index);
120                index = buffer.write("full_message", fullMessage, index);
121                index = buffer.writeDouble("timestamp", timeStamp, index, 0);
122                index = buffer.writeInt("level", level, index, 0);
123                index = buffer.write("_time", timeFormatter.format(now), index);
124                index = buffer.write("_level", LevelFormatter.toString(event.level()), index);
125                index = buffer.write("_logger", event.loggerName(), index);
126                index = buffer.write("_thread_name", event.threadName(), index);
127                index = buffer.write("_thread_id", String.valueOf(event.threadId()), index);
128
129                if (t != null) {
130                        String tn = t.getClass().getCanonicalName();
131                        if (tn == null) {
132                                tn = t.getClass().getName();
133                        }
134                        index = buffer.write("_throwable", tn, index);
135                }
136
137                var kvs = event.keyValues();
138
139                /*
140                 * output headers
141                 */
142                for (int i = headers.start(); i >= 0; i = headers.next(i)) {
143                        String k = headers.key(i);
144                        if (kvs.getValueOrNull(k) != null) {
145                                continue;
146                        }
147                        String v = headers.valueOrNull(i);
148                        index = buffer.write(k, v, index, EXTENDED_F);
149                }
150
151                /*
152                 * output MDC
153                 */
154                for (int i = kvs.start(); i >= 0; i = kvs.next(i)) {
155                        String k = kvs.key(i);
156                        String v = kvs.valueOrNull(i);
157                        index = buffer.write(k, v, index, EXTENDED_F);
158                }
159
160                index = buffer.write("version", "1.1", index);
161
162                if (index > 0 && prettyprint) {
163                        buffer.writeLineFeed();
164                }
165                buffer.write(JSONToken.OBJECT_END);
166                buffer.writeLineFeed();
167        }
168
169        private int levelToSyslogLevel(Level level) {
170                /*
171                 * FROM LOGBACK The syslog severity of a logging event is converted from the level
172                 * of the logging event. The DEBUG level is converted to 7, INFO is converted to
173                 * 6, WARN is converted to 4 and ERROR is converted to 3.
174                 */
175                int r = switch (level) {
176                        case ERROR -> 3;
177                        case DEBUG -> 7;
178                        case INFO -> 6;
179                        case TRACE -> 7;
180                        case WARNING -> 4;
181                        case ALL -> 7;
182                        case OFF -> 0;
183                };
184                return r;
185        }
186
187}
